byline.contributor: Michael Forsythe reported from Hong Kong, and Jonathan Ansfield from Beijing. Keith Bradsher and Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Hong Kong.
byline.original: By MICHAEL FORSYTHE and JONATHAN ANSFIELD

abstract: China's Communist elite has been shaken by faltering economy and anti-corruption effort that has reached high into party's ranks; both developments have exposed Pres Xi Jinping, who took helm for both country's economic policy and anti-corruption drive, to criticism and threatened his success.
lead_paragraph: A slowdown could mark the end of fast growth, while a campaign against official corruption has continued longer and reached higher than most had expected.

headline.main: Fading Economy and Graft Crackdown Rattle China’s Leaders
headline.print_headline: Fading Economy and Corruption Vex China’s Elite

snippet: A slowdown could mark the end of fast growth, while a campaign against official corruption has continued longer and reached higher than most had expected.
